message.content: This question tests basic knowledge about solar energy and its absorption by plants. Plants absorb solar energy through a process called photosynthesis. Option (C), planted flowers on a bright, clear day, is correct because it represents a situation where there is ample sunlight for the plants to absorb and convert into energy. Option (A) is incorrect because the moonlight does not provide the same intensity of solar energy as sunlight. Option (B) is incorrect because potted flowers in a windowless room would not receive sunlight and therefore cannot absorb solar energy. Option (D) is incorrect because although seeds do need sunlight to germinate and sprout, they do not directly absorb solar energy.

This question requires knowledge about solar energy and photosynthesis. Solar energy is absorbed by plants during photosynthesis. Option (A) is incorrect because solar energy is not available under moonlight. Option (B) is incorrect because potted flowers in a windowless room would not have access to sunlight. Option (D) is incorrect because seeds that have just been planted in the ground have not yet sprouted and established the ability to absorb solar energy. Only option (C) mentions planted flowers on a bright, clear day, which would have access to sunlight and be able to absorb solar energy.

This question tests knowledge about solar energy and its absorption by plants. Solar energy is absorbed by plants through the process of photosynthesis. In order for plants to absorb solar energy, they need to be exposed to bright sunlight. Option (A) is incorrect because the moonlight does not provide sufficient solar energy for plants to absorb. Option (B) is incorrect because plants in a windowless room would not receive any sunlight. Option (D) is incorrect because newly planted seeds have not yet grown into plants that are capable of absorbing solar energy.

This question requires knowledge about how solar energy is absorbed. Solar energy is absorbed by objects that are exposed to sunlight. Option (A) is incorrect because plants cannot absorb solar energy under moonlight, as moonlight does not provide the same level of energy as sunlight. Option (B) is incorrect because potted flowers in a windowless room would not receive any sunlight. Option (D) is incorrect because seeds that have just been planted in the ground would not have had sufficient time to absorb solar energy. Thus, the correct answer is option (C), planted flowers on a bright, clear day, as they would be exposed to sunlight and can absorb solar energy.
